CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 10, 1945, p.1, reads: "DISPLAYS INJURIES IN EQUAL RIGHTS CASE - George Pierce (center), 556 Delmont Avenue, opens his shirt to the court to display injuries he said he received when forcibly ejected from the White - Hawk Cafe on Homewood Avenue, last week, while he was attempting to be served. Howard Sullivan, bartender at the restaurant, defendant in case, is shown on the far right.  Charles Gaines, 828 Bryn Mawr Road, who said he was refused service at the bar before Pierce entered, but was sold a wrapped sandwich, is shown on the left.  The case was held for court by Alderman Harry Fitzgerald. - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Charles Gaines, George Pierce displaying bandaged shoulder, and White Hawk bartender Howard Sullivan, at bench of Alderman Harry Fitzgerald, for equal rights assault case against Sullivan
